Ad Text:
IXOM plays a vital part in the lives of tens of millions of people every day. We're the experts behind the scenes, ensuring safe and reliable access and helping industries, businesses, and local communities thrive.


Our products, services and solutions are used across many end markets, including dairy, agriculture, viticulture, electricity, steel, food and beverage, pulp and paper, mining and construction, and water treatment (just to name a few).


We are supported by over 1,300 people globally and our operations span across four continents and nine countries, with headquarters in Melbourne, Australia.





About your role

As a Senior Strategy Analyst, you'll be a key force behind shaping our strategic direction and driving high-impact decisions. This role is ideal for someone who thrives at the intersection of commercial thinking and analytical depth—transforming complex data into clear, actionable insights that fuel growth and sharpen our competitive edge.

Reporting to Head of Strategy (who reports to CFO), you'll work closely with cross-functional teams including Finance, HR, Operations, and Commercial, identifying opportunities, assessing risks, and supporting executive-level initiatives that influence the future of the business.

Key Responsibilities

Lead end-to-end strategic projects—from hypothesis development to execution
Analyse market trends, competitor movements, and internal performance metrics
Support the annual Corporate Planning process with data-driven insights
Develop and present strategic recommendations to senior stakeholders
Contribute to corporate development activities including M&A, partnerships, and investments
Build financial models and scenario analyses to forecast outcomes and guide decisions
Collaborate across departments to shape and refine business strategies
Track execution of strategic initiatives and measure success against key KPIs

Who are we looking for?

Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Economics or a related field (MBA highly regarded)
5+ years' experience in strategy consulting, corporate strategy, or a similar analytical role
Exceptional problem-solving and critical thinking skills
Advanced proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, and strategic modelling tools
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills
Proven ability to manage multiple priorities and deliver results in a fast-paced environment

Benefits at IXOM

For a start, you'll work for a large global organisation, where you'll not only earn a competitive salary, but you'll also have access to an Employee Assistance Program, a recognition program, and a range of health and wellness benefits and discounts.

Our wellbeing program is second to none, and we offer a range of education assistance and learning resources, as well as secondment and promotion opportunities to help you grow both personally and professionally.

We support what's important to you by promoting workplace giving, diversity and providing volunteering leave, and, of course, we offer flexible working wherever possible.

To Apply

If this sounds like you, we'd love to hear from you!

Our Process

At IXOM we are committed to employing individuals who align with our values and meet the requirements of the role. As part of the recruitment process, there are a number of checks which may be conducted to demonstrate applicants' suitability for a role including police / criminal background checks, medical, drug and alcohol testing, and reference checks.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact our Talent Acquisition team.

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
This well know utilities organisation is looking for a Senior Data Specialist to design and deliver scalable data pipelines, models, and automation across the Azure ecosystem.

Key activities

Develop and maintain Azure Data Factory, Databricks, and Delta lake pipelines.
Build Lakehouse/Data Warehouse models using medallion architecture.
Implement CI/CD pipelines with Azure DevOps for automation and delivery.
Collaborate with stakeholders to create reusable, high-quality data assets.
Support analytics, dashboards, and machine learning initiatives.
Ensure performance, governance, and continuous improvement of data platforms.

Skills and experience

Strong experience in Azure Data Services, Databricks, and data modelling.
Proven ability to design scalable, reliable data solutions.
Hands-on CI/CD experience with Azure DevOps.
Excellent problem-solving and stakeholder engagement skills.
Relevant degree or Microsoft Azure certification highly regarded.

Apply now to secure an interview or contact Alistair Barr on 0480 804 53 for a confidential discussion.

Company: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
Ad Text:
Are you a Power BI expert who loves transforming data into stories that drive real business impact?


This well know utilities organisation are seeking a Senior Power BI Specialist to join a forward-thinking team using data to shape customer experience, billing performance, and service delivery.

Key activities

Design impactful, self-service dashboards that turn complex data into actionable insight.
Build and maintain robust Power BI models using DAX, Power Query, and Azure data services.
Translate business needs into intuitive analytics solutions across customer, billing, and sales domains.
Collaborate with data engineers and business leaders to deliver trusted, high-quality insights.
Champion data storytelling, upskill users, and drive adoption of BI across the business.

Skills and experience

Deep Power BI expertise, including DAX, modelling, and performance optimisation.
Hands-on experience with Azure Data Services (Data Factory, Synapse, Databricks).
A knack for turning complexity into clarity and communicating insights that matter.
Experience integrating data from systems like Salesforce, billing, or ERP platforms.

Apply now to secure an interview or contact Josh D'Monte on 0401 817 025 for a confidential discussion.
